City Council
============

![web_CouncilDSC01254-Edit](https://www.snohomishwa.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=8943 "web_CouncilDSC01254-Edit")

9

1

1

1

2024 City Council
-----------------

*(l to r) Council President Tom Merrill, Karen Guzak, Lea Anne Burke, Mayor Linda Redmon, Maygen Heatherington, Judith Kuleta, Felix Neals, David Flynn*

Mayor and Councilmembers
========================

The Mayor and City Council is made up of the following elected community members:

* [Linda Redmon](mailto:redmon@snohomishwa.gov), Mayor - Term Ends December 31, 2025
* [Maygen Hetherington](mailto:hetherington@snohomishwa.gov), Position 1 - Term Ends December 31, 2027
* [Judith Kuleta](mailto:kuleta@snohomishwa.gov), Position 2 - Term Ends December 31, 2027
* [Felix Neals](mailto:neals@snohomishwa.gov), Position 3 - Term Ends December 31, 2027
* [Tom Merrill](mailto:merrill@snohomishwa.gov), Position 4 - Term Ends December 31, 2025
* [David Flynn](mailto:flynn@snohomishwa.gov), Position 5 - Term Ends December 31, 2025
* [Lea Anne Burke](mailto:l.burke@snohomishwa.gov), Position 6 - Term Ends December 31, 2025
* [Karen Guzak](mailto:guzak@snohomishwa.gov), Position 7 - Term Ends December 31, 2025

Function of the Mayor and Council
---------------------------------

The seven-member City Council is responsible for the legislative function of and the overall vision for the City. The Council adopts ordinances and resolutions, sets policies, and approves contracts and budgets.

City Council members are elected to four-year terms and serve part-time and do not maintain office hours at City Hall.

[Mayor Linda Redmon](https://www.snohomishwa.gov/662/Mayors-Office) was elected in November 2021 to implement Council policies and administer the day-to-day business of the City. The Mayor appoints individuals to boards and commissions.

Council Meetings
----------------

**6 p.m. first and third Tuesday of each month**

All meetings are open to the public and are currently held in a hybrid format: in-person in the Lower Level of Carnegie (105 Cedar) and via Zoom ([link provided in the agenda](https://www.snohomishwa.gov/AgendaCenter)).

The City Council Chambers are accessible to people with disabilities. Anyone who needs specialized accommodations should provide 5 days advanced notice by contacting the City Clerk’s Office at 360-568-3115.

Public Comment
--------------

Public comments are welcome at all City Council meetings. Meetings begin with a public comment period where residents may speak on any city-related topic. Residents may also comment on Public Hearings or Action items during the meeting. In-person comments should be limited to 3 minutes in length. Residents may also submit written public comment to Council via mail or e-mail to the [City Clerk](mailto:cityclerk@snohomishwa.gov). Comments must be received by 3 p.m. the day of the meeting.

Public hearings offer particular opportunities for citizens to comment on important issues such as new ordinances, City budget, comprehensive plan amendments or adoption, and interlocal agreements.

Council Workshops, which precede council meetings, are for council information and discussion only. No citizen comments are accepted.

Public comment, types of meetings, rules of decorum, and other Council conducts of business are passed by resolution, the most current of which can be found here.

Council Agendas and Minutes
---------------------------

City Council documents are available in the [Document Center](https://portal.laserfiche.com/Portal/browse.aspx?repo=r-98fe181f). Adobe Reader may be required to view certain documents.

Historical Records available through the [Washington State Digital Archives](https://digitalarchives.wa.gov/):

City Council Minutes: 1888-2017  
City Council Resolutions: 1937-2019  
City Council Ordinances: 1890-1983 and 1997-2018
